bibl.title: The Asyut Project: Seventh Season of Fieldwork (2009). Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Ancient necropolis of Asyut, Joint mission of Sohag University, Johannes Gutenberg-Universität Mainz and Freie Universität Berlin. The area of O11 with the "Tomb of the Dogs" was cleaned opening a gallery with huge amounts of carcasses of canids and other animals. Late antique and medieval remains were examined in the region of the monastery of Deir el-Azzam.
bibl.seg: Kahl Jochem, Mahmoud El-Khadragy, Ursula Verhoeven, Silvia Prell, Ina Eichner and Thomas Beckh, The Asyut Project: Seventh Season of Fieldwork (2009). Avec résumé en anglais.
Studien zur Altägyptischen Kultur 39 (2010) pp. 191-210, 12 figg. et pll. 14-19.

Ancient necropolis of Asyut, Joint mission of Sohag University, Johannes Gutenberg-Universität Mainz and Freie Universität Berlin. The area of O11 with the "Tomb of the Dogs" was cleaned opening a gallery with huge amounts of carcasses of canids and other animals. Late antique and medieval remains were examined in the region of the monastery of Deir el-Azzam.
Kahl El-Khadragy Verhoeven Prell Eichner Beckh
